title: Breaking Sheffield and South Yorkshire news - BBC News
summary: domestic abuse in focus on white ribbon day .
hole in house wall after car smash .
end of era for radio sheffield newsreader .
live sheffield and south yorkshire news on friday 24 november 2016 .

documents.title: wolves 0-2 sheffield wednesday
text: wolves 0-2 sheffield wednesday

documents.title: barnsley 2-5 nottingham forest
text: barnsley 2-5 nottingham forest

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: an eventful friday , here 's what 's been happening :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: three teens remanded over moorland murder
text: three 15-year-old boys have been remanded in custody after being charged with the murder of a man whose body was found on moorland .
the boys appeared at rotherham youth court accused of murdering 34-year-old craig nelson , south yorkshire police said .
the body of mr nelson , also known as craig peston , was found off the a628 at the woodhead tunnels on august 22 .
a post-mortem examination found that he died as a result of head injuries .
the three boys , who ca n't be named , will appear before sheffield crown court at a later date .
author: Rebecca Kerry
Journalist, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: watch : pit tragedy in barnsley remembered
text: it 's 150 years since hundreds of people were killed in a huge explosion at oaks colliery in barnsley .
a special exhibition about what happened begins next week at the experience barnsley museum .
i 've has a look round before it opens to the public :
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: weather tonight
text: clear spells but we should avoid a frost with a bit of luck .
unless you like frost .
in which case , hard luck .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: council sorry for dawn tree-felling
text: council sorry for dawn tree-felling

documents.title: drug dealer behind bars
text: this is drug dealer zain ali .
he 's been given six years and 10 months for dealing in heroin and crack cocaine .
the court heard how ali , of burngreave road , sheffield , was arrested by officers earlier this year in possession of heroin and crack cocaine .
an investigation began into ali 's drug dealing when he was arrested again he had even more illegal drugs .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: watch : 'speedy ' sheedy gets middleweight title chance
text: sheffield middleweight boxer sam sheedy has the chance of a lifetime tomorrow night when he faces british and commonwealth champion tommy langford in cardiff .
sheedy , who boxes out of glyn rhodes ' gym , has n't yet reached his potential in the ring , mainly due to the top british fighters avoiding the 28-year-old .
but he 's earned himself the right to face the unbeaten langford and become the british champion :
author: Shamir Masri
BBC Look North

documents.title: breakingapology from council over 'dawn raid ' tree felling
text: people were left furious last week when contractors for sheffield city council worked with police to move cars and fell trees before day-break on rustlings road in sheffield .
we 've just received this apology over the way this was done from the council :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: a story of domestic abuse and a young boy
text: today has been chosen by campaigners to highlight domesitc abuse and they 've dubbed it white ribbon day .
it 's an idea that began in canada with people wearing white ribbons to highlight the issue of abuse in the home .
south yorkshire police are supporting the campaign and have sent out a story of how domestic abuse blighted the life of a child and his mother .
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: watch : squash champ hosts charity matches
text: sheffield 's nick matthew says he 's pleased that so many people helped make a success of the inaugural steel city cup squash event in aid of the children 's hospital charity .
the event has raised more than £ 4,000 and saw celebrity players getting involved , including bbc presenter dan walker .
nick matthew has won all the top titles in the sport and says the event should pay off in several ways :
author: Andy Giddings
Sports Editor, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: appeal for missing mia
text: this is mia bell .
she 's 69 and has n't been seen since tuesday .
police say she was seen .
near to a sainsbury 's supermarket in edenthorpe , doncaster .
they 're asking the public to contact them on 101 if she 's seen .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: watch : tram train - more delays to project
text: the south yorkshire tram train experiment has been delayed again .
the bbc understands it could now be summer 2018 before the sheffield to rotherham service runs .
it should have started in january this year .
meanwhile all the tram trains themselves have been delivered .
tom ingall 's report features andrew dennif , chief executive of the rotherham and barnsley chamber of commerce :
author: Tom Ingall
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: road workers punched , threatened and driven at in sheffield
text: road workers have been punched , threatened and driven into by motorists angry at road closures in sheffield .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: your lunchtime headlines
text: your lunchtime headlines
author: Rebecca Kerry
Journalist, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: fond farewells in their droves for everard davy
text: everard davy says he wo n't miss getting up early to read the news .
radio sheffield 's 'voice of news ' has now read his last bulletin and he 's cycled off into retirement .
his unique style and laconic wit has struck a chord with listeners for decades .
these are just a few of the messages we 've had about him :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: lunchtime weather update
text: sightings of something called 'the sun ' are being reported .
a welcome sight after the last week or so .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: emu on the loose for a while .
text: police on doncaster have had an unusual call-out over an emu on the loose .
they have n't gone into detail about the who , what and when but we just love the photo .
intersting call this morning about a loose emu in intake doncaster .
we managed to find it safe and well
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: further delays for tram-train scheme
text: further delays for tram-train scheme

documents.title: hole in house wall after car smash
text: police have made an arrest after a car smashed through the wall of a house in barnsley .
the accident was just off pontefract road on oakwell vale just before midnight .
no one in the house was hurt .
this is the mess left after a car smashed into a house in barnsley .
author: Oli Constable

documents.title: mp writes of dementia heartbreak
text: barnsley east mp michael dugher tells of how dementia left his grandmother `` bewildered and terrified '' .
he 's written about the impact on the disease in his local newspaper , the barnsley chronicle .
dementia is the worst kind of thief : mp speaks of heartbreak after disease claims life of grandmother @ twitterid
it was n't helped by the chancellor not even bothering to mention # socialcare in his autumn statement this week
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: boris : the musical
text: there are few characters in life who prompt the thought that a musical should be made about them .
enter boris : the musical .
it 's on at sheffield students ' union on sunday after selling out the library theatre in the city earlier this year .
two of the people behind it popped into bbc radio sheffield :
author: Toby Foster
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: listen : yorkshire coach gale 'relishing ' prospect of day/night games
text: the fixtures for the 2017 county championship season were released overnight , and yorkshire will start the campaign at home to hampshire on friday 7 april .
headingley will also host its first day/night championship fixture against surrey from monday 26 june .
yorkshire 's newly-appointed head coach andrew gale has told me he 's excited at the prospect of the new season :
author: Dave Fletcher
BBC Yorkshire Sport

documents.title: barnsley school holiday plans reaction
text: barnsley council plans to change the length of school holidays , making the summer break shorter and adding a week to a half-term .
the national union of teachers has compiled a summary of responses to the idea from its members .
some of the comments are here .
what do you think of the plan ?
tell us .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: domestic abuse in focus on white ribbon day
text: white ribbon day ?
what 's that ?
it 's a way of highlighting the .
international day for the elimination of violence against women .
how did it get going ?
in 1991 , a handful of men in canada decided they had a responsibility to urge men to speak out against violence against women .
they decided that wearing a white ribbon would be a symbol of men 's opposition to men 's violence against women .
there are now white ribbon campaigns operating in many countries around the world .
morning , today we 're supporting # whiteribbonday to help end # domesticabuse against women .
if you 're affected , tell someone , we will listen .
you are n't too fussed about domestic violence against men then ?
hi we take all domestic abuse seriously for both men & women .
today is international day for elimination of violence against women
`` to help domestic abuse against women '' really ?
this kind of language is out of date and both damages and prevents male reporting .
@ twitterid @ twitterid rewording is no prob for me abuse can affect anyone & survivors should all feel we help each other
any morning calls around gleadless by any change ?
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: plan to ban smoking from outside public buildings in sheffield
text: smokers could be banned from lighting up outside sheffield 's public buildings , under proposals to be put to residents .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: watch : impressive oriental light show
text: if you 're heading to leeds between now and the end of the year then you should know there 's something pretty striking going on ; the world 's biggest chinese lantern festival has come to roundhay park in leeds .
it 's on until january - see more below :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: how we used to live
text: a hose-blast from the past .
how about this evocative photo from barnsley archives .
yes , you can see the town hall being built , covered in scaffold in the distance .
if you 'd like to share any photos with us , old or new , we 'd love to see them , just click here .
# autoarchives a 1930s fire engine you can spot a half built barnsley town hall in the background @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
@ twitterid great photo , my grandfather drove one very like this in london during the blitz
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: watch : end of era for radio sheffield newsreader
text: he 's been working on radio for more than 30 years and everard davy has been reading the breakfast news on bbc radio sheffield for the last 20 years .
today he 's hanging up his microphone and retiring .
that news has prompted listeners to get in touch and praise his unique style ; they love his authority and the occasional mischief and leg-pulling he 's well-known for .
here 's everard doing one of his final bulletins :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: breakingcar crashes into house in barnsley
text: these photos show the damage left when a car struck a house on pontefract road in barnsley overnight .
the road was closed but is now back to normal after the incident near oakwell lane .

documents.title: 'nightmare ' parking fine over sold car
text: a driver has won an 18-month `` nightmare '' battle over £ 1,000 parking fines on a car he no longer owned .
andrew horrobin , from coalville , leicestershire , sold his renault in november 2014 but months later it was caught parked in a sheffield bus lane .
sheffield city council said it twice sent bailiffs to mr horrobin 's home after he had failed to make contact .
mr horrobin insisted he got in touch but once a deadline had been missed no-one would listen to his explanation .

documents.title: watch : weather behaving itself as instructed
text: we placed an order for a break from all the rain and it 's day two of that request being enacted .
here 's lucy :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

text: news , sport , weather and travel across the day .
do n't mention black friday .
agreed ?
good .
let 's see how long we can keep that one up
gorgeous image sent in by bazzer of a view in rotherham .
do send us your and stories .
it 's easy .
click here .

BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me but our feed of breaking news and travel updates will continue overnight .
today we 've learned :
you can send us your and stories here .

BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: carvalhal 'gives time ' to owls signings
text: carvalhal 'gives time ' to owls signings

documents.title: weather tonight
text: dry with patchy cloud , could be a frost for some but generally a bit warmer than that .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: being a 'bird-brain ' is now a good thing
text: that 's the conclusion of patients at a mental health unit balby , at least .
they say bird watching improves a person 's mood .
former patient johnny gillespie noticed that watching birds from the window of his room proved to be therapeutic .
a bird watching scheme developed .
with bird feeders being placed outside and links with bird watchers were forged .
the scheme is at the doncaster adult mental health inpatient unit , which is run by rotherham doncaster and south humber nhs foundation trust ( rdash ) .
the bird watching scheme has had a huge impact on patients and staff - we ca n't believe what a huge difference such a small change can make . ''
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: pub gains protection from sell-off trend
text: the white lion pub on london road in sheffield now has protection having been given `` asset of community value '' status .
it means tighter controls over its use and there 's a chance for the community to buy it if it goes up for sale .
you can read more here .
another pub has gained community protection to help prevent it from being sold off or redeveloped in the future
congratulations on writing a great uk gov tweet .
( ranked 18th for nov 24 . )
give # stonethecrows a prominent place in the new development of our city centre .
deserves to be promoted .
great shopping
great now help the landlord survive .
and locals back the place by using it regularly
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: 'urban explorers ' record plane visit
text: 'urban explorers ' record plane visit

documents.title: listen : 'energy from the stands ' in millers v leeds united match
text: they often refer to the crowd as being the 12th man on the pitch ; that extra oomph that can propel a team to victory .
hear how it 's hoped to be a factor for rotherham in their upcoming match :
listen : # rufc boss kenny jackett ahead of the # millers derby clash against # lufc
author: Jonathan Buchan
BBC Radio Sheffield Sport

documents.title: petition to block sheffield libary move
text: thousands of people have been signing a petition to prevent sheffield central library from being moved to make way for a five-star hotel .
we brought news of the plan earlier this week .
as part of the scheme the library would be found a new home somewhere in the city centre .
author: James Vincent
Reporter BBC Look North

documents.title: pharmacy funding : councillors vote to oppose cuts in doncaster
text: i 'm at a council meeting in doncaster where councillors have been discussing fears that at least 20 community pharmacies in the town may have to close because of government budget cuts .
lats month the department of health said it wanted to reduce the £ 2.8bn-a-year pharmacy bill by more than £ 200m over the next two years .
councillors in doncaster have just voted unanimously to approve a motion which opposes cuts to community pharmacy services .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: drugs charges after police searches in sheffield
text: two men have been remanded in custody on drugs charges after houses were searched in sheffield on monday .
sajid hussain , 34 , from burngreave is charged with possession with intent to supply and will appear at sheffield crown court on 22 december .
also facing the same charge is 37-year-old abid hussain from burngreave .
he is due to appear in court on 23 december .
police say around 15kg of suspected class a drugs were recovered from the warrants , as well as cash , firearms , and a mechanical press , which is believed to have been used in drugs production .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: hospital charity wants you to get 'elfy '
text: a festive fundraising effort is being staged by sheffield children 's hospital charity .
people are being encouraged to get in the spirit by doing events with an elf theme to bring in funds .
the charity helps to improve the hospital environment as well as paying for £ 250,000 of research each year into the prevention and cure of childhood illnesses .

documents.title: black friday : how does it compare with other shopping bonanzas ?
text: you 've seen all the signs and adverts , had your inbox flooded with emails offering `` massive discounts '' and `` unmissable deals '' .
there 's no escaping black friday .
falling on 25 november this year , black friday originated in the united states .

the day follows the us thanksgiving holiday ( the fourth thursday in november ) and is seen as the start of the holiday season with shoppers hoping to snap up bargains and save on their christmas shopping .
i 've been looking at how the discount day compares with other retail bonanzas ?
author: Tim Bowler
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: up to 120 sheffield jobs to go from global fencing company
text: a global fencing firm is planning to cut more than 100 jobs at its sheffield site as part of its uk restructuring plans .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: police face abuse inquiry complaints
text: police face abuse inquiry complaints
author: Tom Symonds
Home Affairs correspondent

documents.title: former barnsley defender paul futcher dies
text: former barnsley defender paul futcher has died at the age of 60 .
he started his career with chester before moving to luton with twin brother ron in 1974 .
the ex-england under-21 international became the most expensive defender in english football when he moved to manchester city for £ 350,000 in 1978 .
he spent six seasons with barnsley before three with grimsby town , helping them win promotion to the second tier .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: barnsley 's got talent
text: auditions for the tv show britain 's got talent are coming to barnsley .
the event is next week and barnsley college performing arts students have formed a dance troupe to try to impress the judges .
they only found out a few weeks ago that the auditions are being held at the college 's old mill lane campus next tuesday , and quickly put together the troupe .
anyone wanting to attend an audition has to book .
to be given this opportunity right on our doorstep is amazing and i 'm so happy to be sharing it with such a great bunch of people .
we all love studying here and this will be a wonderful memory to be able to take away with us . ''
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: 'grim for family finances
text: the outlook for family finances is a `` grim with little respite from measures announced in the autumn statement , a think tank has said .
the biggest losers between now and 2020 are lower income families , with the poorest third likely to see incomes drop , the resolution foundation said .
that could mean the squeeze on living standards could be worse during this parliament than between 2010 and 2015 .
treasury documents confirm the poorest and the very richest will be hit .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: cyber-crime alert ahead of black friday
text: black friday , cyber monday two of the shopping days when businesses look forward to a boost in takings .
however , also looking to benefit are criminals looking to get at people 's money through cyber crime .
south yorkshire police are warning people to be aware of the risks as they look for bargains .
some people will take risks if they think they are bagging a bargain , while others might be less familiar with the safeguards that can keep their money safe online . ''
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: boys will be boys and so will the girls !
text: there 's a grand tradition of drag queens and men dressing up as women for entertainment in this country - especially with panto season just round the corner .
but what about drag kings ?
that 's women dressing up as men .
there 's a new drag king night starting up this weekend in a quiet suburb of sheffield .
author: Rony Robinson
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: teenager suffers fractured skull and bleeding on the brain in sheffield nightclub fall
text: a teenager who suffered serious head injuries from falling down stairs at a sheffield nightclub is appealing for witnesses .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: doncaster 's masterplan to transform the town
text: big ambitions are shown in a masterplan which sets out a string of projects to change the face of doncaster .
retail , leisure and residential projects aim to bring the town that wants to be called a city up-to-date .
here 's a summary of some of the main points :

documents.title: cctv image over sex assault report
text: this is an image which police hope will help to solve a sex assault report in doncaster .
the image is being released after months of investigation into the incident which involved a woman who says she was attacked by a man she 'd met on a night out in may of this year .
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: woman , 25 , scarred for life after being glassed in unprovoked sheffield pub attack
text: rosie skitt went into a pub for a quiet drink - but came out scarred for life after another woman smashed a glass in her face .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: former footballers get special abuse helpline
text: the nspcc has opened a dedicated telephone helpline - in response to a number of former footballers waiving their anonymity to speak out about the sexual abuse they suffered as children .
eleven people have contacted police since andy woodward - who played for sheffield united - told a newspaper that he 'd been abused by a coach at crewe alexandra who was jailed in the late 90s .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: sports headlines
text: sports headlines
author: Andy Giddings
Sports Editor, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: south yorkshire dominates police failure complaints
text: new figures show the independent police complaints commission is dealing with nearly 200 investigations into police failures in dealing with child sexual abuse .
a good number of those investigations , 53 cases , are in south yorkshire , related to the much-publicised abuse scandal in rotherham .
author: Everard Davy
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: airport hangar 'break-in ' claim
text: doncaster sheffield airport 's investigating reports of an alleged security breach at the weekend .
a post on youtube shows three men apparently breaking into a hangar at the site .
the airport says the incident was immediately reported to the relevant authorities who are now investigating .
a spokesman for doncaster sheffield airport goes on to stress that the ongoing safety and security of passengers is their number one priority .
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: watch : weather for thursday
text: abbie does n't mention the 'rain ' word .
we 'll take that .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

text: coming up , the men who claim their video shows them breaking in to a hangar at doncaster sheffield airport .
we 'll have news , sport , weather and travel across the day

thanks graham ; you can send your and stories to us here

documents.title: police seize cars in crime crackdown
text: a police operation which has been targeting foreign national offenders who use the road network to carry out crimes is being branded a success by south yorkshire police .
so far this week eight people have been arrested , 144 vehicles have been stopped and 29 cars seized .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: weather update : dry and cold
text: we should stay dry tonight , cold but not as cold as some nights we 've seen of late .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: new flood defences confirmed in doncaster
text: as anticipated , the chancellor has confirmed that stainforth is to get new flood defences to improve protection for homes .
stainforth was hit by flooding in 2007 when the river don breached its banks .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: 'model ' employees ? bbc look north staff are no dummies
text: what does an average day look like at bbc look north ?
take a look to find out more as part of our # mannequinchallenge attempt
the challenge is the newest sensation on the internet and requires groups of participants to assume dramatic poses , which is why everyone in the film is static like a dummy .
usually , there 's a lot more dashing about !
anyway , we 've used the challenge as an excuse to show you behind the scenes at bbc yorkshire 's hq in leeds :
author: BBC Look North

documents.title: teenager reports sex assault on a bus
text: this cctv image shows a man police want to speak to after a claim of sexual assault .
a 17-year-old girl who was on the 72a bus from sheffield interchange , says she was assaulted by a man .
who also got on the bus at the interchange .
more about the incident here .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: cycling road world championships millions announced
text: in 2019 yorkshire will see another big cycling event ; the uci road world championships .
today the chancellor has announced tens of millions of pounds to pay for cycling infrastructure and to help stage the event .
autumn statement : £ 24 million will go towards hosting the cycling road world championships in yorkshire in 2019 and for cycle infrastructure
author: James Vincent
Reporter BBC Look North

text: stately house awarded £ 7.6m grant

BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: barnsley lights switch on
text: barnsley 's christmas lights are being switched on today .
preparations are coming to an end and the stage for the celebrations has been set up .
there are some road closures affecting the town centre and the lights will be switched on at 18:00 this evening .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: attempted rape on sheffield train
text: there 's a hunt for a man who is said to have tried to rape a woman on a train while her partner was in the toilet .
it 's thought the attacker was with another man and police have given a detailed description of the wanted man .
it happened on a train from sheffield to leeds at the weekend .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: touching message from jo cox 's husband
text: the husband of murdered mp jo cox has been taking to social media to share a message he says he wants people to take to heart .
brendan cox says he and the couple 's children were lucky to have been able to have jo in their lives .
today , thomas mair has been found guilty of her murder .
jo lit up our lives .
and she still does .
# jocox # truepatriot # moreincommon
@ twitterid guess your day on thames with kids taken out of school shouting at fishermen was a normal day out # antigb
what 's that got to do with the price of fish troll ?
who really knows , i am told this is the case .
i am more inclined believe young vulnerable girls have had their lives destroyed
ceo of oxfam , house boat in london , campaigned for syrian rebels everything wrong with politics !
@ twitterid jo was more of a patriot and a englishwoman than the twisted sick charlatan that brought harm to her .
i only new of her after she had her life brutally for being involved in our democratic process and that makes us all losers .
@ twitterid jo lit up our lives .
and she still does .
# jocox # truepatriot # moreincommon
x x
she stood for everything i believe in .
much love to her and you .
x
i ca n't begin to understand your strength and dignity .
you are inspiring .
jo is one of my heroes and i 'll never forget her courage and heart .
she represented the best of humanity .
@ twitterid i 'm so sorry for what happened to jo , i can only imagine the heartbreak you 've all been through .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: the man who murdered jo cox
text: the bbc has compiled a summary of the activities and life of thomas mair who has been found guilty of killing mp jo cox in her constituency .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: jo cox 's husband reacts to the murder verdict
text: the guilty verdict against thomas mair for killing mp jo cox in the street has prompted reaction from her husband , brendan cox .
he 's been speaking about how he and their children view their time with jo .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: millions for wentworth woodhouse
text: some good news locally coming out of the autumn statement about wentworth woodhouse .
more than £ 7.5 million is going to the stately home near rotherham , which the chancellor described as being at a 'critical state of being lost to future generations ' .
the building needs extensive work estimated at a cost of £ 42 million and restoration could take 15 years to complete .
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: weather update : brollies away all being well
text: getting brighter and it should be dry overnight .
high of 7c .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: football sex abuse update : more people come forward
text: cheshire police have now said that 11 people have come forward to give information in relation to child sex abuse in football .
it comes after a former sheffield united player claimed he 'd suffered abuse as a child .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: thomas mair found guilty of murdering jo cox
text: more on the news that the man accused of murdering batley and spen labour mp jo cox has been found guilty by a jury at the old bailey .
thomas mair , 53 , was accused of shooting and stabbing the mother-of-two in birstall on 16 june , a week before the eu referendum vote .
at his trial , mr mair denied murdering the mother-of-two and chose not to give any evidence in his defence .

documents.title: breakingjo cox trial : thomas mair found guilty of mp 's murder
text: thomas mair , accused of murdering batley and spen labour mp jo cox , has been found guilty by a jury at the old bailey .
more to follow

documents.title: pony rail deaths : the family behind the story
text: these are the people whose two ponies had to be put down after they strayed onto a railway line in barnsley .
they blame network rail for the incident , which in turn has denied responsibility over a damaged fence alongside the track .
you can see more here .
darryl ashby & his 11 yo daughter sammy from barnsley whose horses 'tinkerbell & toni ' were hit by a train on monday and had to be put down
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: kel brook does the honours at gym opening
text: sheffield 's kell brook does n't often wear a suit to the gym ; but he 's made an exception today .
the fighter did the curtain-pulling at the opening of a new gym in wisewood .
rt @ twitterid world champion boxer opens a new gym at wisewood leisure centre in # sheffield @ twitterid
author: Tom Ingall
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: public reaction to chinese hotel plan
text: the prospect of sheffield 's central library moving to make way for a 5-star hotel is seeing strong views on social media .
you find out more about the plan here .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: 'fake news ' inquiry by local mp
text: barnsley east mp michael dugher is leading a study on behalf of the labour leadership into news that 's not really news , it 's been made up .
he 's sharing more about it on social media :
michael dugher to head probe into rise of fake news '' for tom watson - @ twitterid

was justifiably sacked for incompetence and disloyalty .

documents.title: sex attack councillor pressured to resign
text: we 've been hearing about councillor from rotherham who has been found guilty of sexual assault .
andrew roddison will be sentenced on december 1st .
our political reporter is following the story .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: man arrested after high speed police chase on three wheels
text: a motorist was arrested after a high-speed police chase in which he continued driving despite losing a tyre .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: flood defence money hopes
text: we 're awaiting confirmation of where new money for flood defences will go in the chancellor 's autumn statement today
campaigners hope that doncaster will be among the areas chosen .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: sex attack councillor awaits sentence
text: a labour councillor in rotherham been found guilty of sexual assault after a woman was attacked in rotherham .
41-year-old andrew roddison of flatts lane in treeton , pleaded not guilty to the charges .
he has been bailed and will be sentenced at leeds magistrates court on 1 december .
the sexual assault happened at a council event after a parade in rotherham in may .
the council 's code of conduct clearly describes the high standards of behaviour which are expected of all elected members .
we now await the sentencing on 1 december . ''
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: drone firm wins £ 8.5m water monitor deal
text: drone firm wins £ 8.5m water monitor deal

documents.title: drone firm wins £ 8.5m contract for european water pollution checks
text: a drone company in rotherham has won a 10 million euro ( £ 8.5m ) contract to monitor the pollution in europe 's rivers and seas .
martek marine is to send two of its two-metre long drones to measure the sulphur and co2 levels emitted from the exhausts of commercial ships .
the european maritime safety agency ( emsa ) will use the data to check if the ships meet current eu standards .
airborne sulphur is a major cause of acid rain harming crops and buildings .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: owner of ponies killed by trains blames network rail
text: network rail have denied they were responsible for the deaths of two ponies hit by trains near darton in barnsley earlier this week .
darryl ashby , the animals ' owner , says it was network rail 's fault because they had not mended a broken trackside fence .
network rail say they had not received any reports of problems with the fence since it was last inspected in the summer .
author: Oli Constable

documents.title: police issue cctv images after violent car theft
text: a man was dragged from his car and beaten , leaving him with two fractured eye sockets during a car robbery in rotherham .
he was attacked at a business park in manvers on 2 october and police hope the images below will help catch his attacker .
the vehicle above , a black vauxhall astra , is thought to be connected to the robbery .
however it 's believed the registration plates are false and may have been switched to another vehicle .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: chinese hotel plan in sheffield prompts anger and praise
text: people in sheffield have been pouring out opinions on a plan to create a five-star hotel by moving sheffield central library to a new home .
the council says the building needs tens of millions of pounds to be spent on maintenance and repairs ; something it ca n't afford .
a chinese investor is interested in developing a top-rated hotel in the city alongside other schemes for apartments in sheffield and a school in china built with help from sheffield .
author: Oli Constable

documents.title: watch : what 's the weather got in store ?
text: cloudy and chilly .
here 's my full forecast
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning
text: i 'll be bringing you the news , sport , weather and travel for south yorkshire until 18:00 .
the weather ahead coming up - it seems you can leave your flippers at home today - and more on the plan to create a five-star hotel in the central library building in sheffield .
your photos and stories always welcome , click here to send
lovely one from badger in rotherham here .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me today , we 'll continue with updates on breaking news and travel this evening and overnight .
today we 've learned that :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: weather outlook
text: rain easing and a chilly night , 6c .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: listen : why turn sheffield 's main library into an hotel ?
text: as people digest the news that sheffield central library could become a five-star hotel , the council has been explaining the wider plan .
that plan sees major investment in the city and more trade deals between sheffield and china .
deputy council leader , leigh bramall , has been telling bbc radio sheffield about the overall scheme :
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: squash champ gets honorary doctorate
text: he 's a multiple world champion ; england 's most sucessful squash player .
sheffield 's nick matthew obe says getting an honorary doctorate from sheffield hallam university is an `` absolute honour '' .

i did a lot of training with the team at cses ( centre for sports and exercise science ) looking at the physiology of sport , nutrition , psychology and biomechanics and they taught me about the marginal gains and the one per cents that people take for granted in this day and age but , going back to the start of my career it was really cutting edge and i owe the university a hell of a lot . ''
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: northern infrastructure divide revealed
text: new research by bbc yorkshire shows we are missing out on billions of pounds of investment to improve key developments like our roads , rails and internet connections .
the figures reveal that the north west is earmarked to get three and half times more money than yorkshire to spend on infrastructure .
our data journalist david rhodes has been looking at the numbers .
author: David Rhodes
BBC Yorkshire

documents.title: sheffield central library could become 5 star hotel
text: sheffield 's central library could make way for a hotel development .
a chinese businessman wants to take over the library to create a 5 star hotel - as part of a £ 1 billion deal between his company and the city .
the library was donated to the city 150 years ago and is housed in the graves building , which also house the graves art gallery .
under the plan the library would move elsewhere but the art gallery would remain .

the project is in its early stages and comes as part of a wider plan to that would also see a £ 30 million apartment block to be built in west bar , a new school to be built by a sheffield architecture firm in the chinese city of chengdu , as well as trade deals with other chinese cities .
in july this year , sheffield city council unveiled a deal with the owner of the sichuan goudong construction group .
for £ 1 billion - with £ 220 million to be spent in the first three years .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: watch : slow-motion lightning strike near barnsley
text: a dash-cam captured a bolt of lightning doing what bolts of lightning do best .
it must be good , even paul hudson is impressed .
have a look :
crikey that 's impressive !
@ twitterid amazing capture
it made one hell of a racket that 's for sure , i must have set every car alarm off in a 5 mile radius : d
you would n't want to be any closer !
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: firm secures second wimbledon roof deal
text: firm secures second wimbledon roof deal

documents.title: watch : the boy , the flood and the life-saving rescue
text: young izaac jones mucked in last night to save a woman caught up in the flooding in hathersage ,
water reached to the top of car roofs and locals were shocked at the speed of the water 's rise .
13 yr old izaac jones helped save a woman who was stranded & suffering with hypothermia in last night 's floods in # hathersage , peak district
author: Mark Ansell
BBC Look North reporter

documents.title: burglar behind bars
text: a man 's been jailed for three years over a burglary in sheffield .
glenn thackray preyed on a block of flats for students .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: hopes high of a deal to save chesterfield fc
text: radio sheffield understands that chesterfield have now secured the £ 200,000 needed to keep the club going for a further month .
sources have told us that they are optimistic that a deal can be done to save the club .
meanwhile on the field , chesterfield will be looking to keep the mk dons within touching distance when the pair meet in league one later .
the spireites are bottom of the table , three places and six points behind their hosts .
author: Andy Giddings
Sports Editor, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: after the flood , the effort to clean up
text: a messy clear up operation is going on in hathersage after floodwaters engulfed cars up to their roofs last night .
author: Mark Ansell
BBC Look North reporter

documents.title: skulls stolen from graves in feud involving south yorkshire travellers still missing
text: skulls stolen from two graves in a feud involving south yorkshire travellers are still missing one year after they were dug up .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: lunchtime weather update
text: showers should ease up during this afternoon but not too warm at 7c .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: police continue operation against uninsured vehicles
text: an effort to catch criminals around south yorkshire is now in full-swing .
it 's called operation trivium and police are publicising what they 're doing on social media as part of the campaign .
a similar exercise last year saw more than 500 vehicles being seized .
# seized on # optrivium in # hexthorpe @ twitterid vehicle no insurance or license and reversed into one of @ twitterid vehicle .
# notyourday

documents.title: watch : 'off the pitch ' focus for sheffield football club
text: afc unity is a football club in sheffield that wants to make a difference off the pitch as well as on it .
they 're doing pretty well and winning lots of awards too - last month they became the first south yorkshire team to win sport england 's satellite club of the year .
they 're up up for a voluntary action sheffield award this week in the make a difference categeory .
the club says it has a clear aim ; ethics and fairness combined with their passion for the sport to make a positive contribution in the local community
author: Rony Robinson
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: watch : inter-faith relief effort in sheffield for syria
text: churches and mosques in sheffield have come together to raise money for syria .
it 's part of wider inter-faith activities that are happening in the city .
the families relief charity has a storage unit at meadowhall business park .
it says its primary role is to support family units as well as individuals , by helping them to build a sustainable future .
i 've been along to see what 's been collected .
author: Waheed Akhtar
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: barnsley pit memorial set to be unveiled next may
text: a sculpture to commemorate the 361 people killed in england 's worst pit disaster is set to be unveiled in next may .
many of the miners and rescuers killed in the explosion at the oaks colliery near stairfoot in barnsley on 12 december 1866 , were never recovered .
sculptor graham ibbeson had ancestors who were killed in the explosion .
events are planned to mark the 150th anniversary of the disaster .
author: Julia Bryson
Journalist, BBC Local Live

documents.title: more hathersage flood stories emerge
text: hathersage saw cars being covered with water last night during the torrential rain .
the fire service and others were called to rescue people who became stranded on school road .
the community rallied , as we see in this tweet .
derbyshire boy helps save stranded couple caught in hathersage floods last night as clean up begins
@ twitterid award considerations need to be made by the authorities @ twitterid @ twitterid ?
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: title-hunt plan for blades
text: sheffield united manager chris wilder believes they are entering a defining period of the season .
the blades host lowly bury today at bramall lane - the first of five home games before the end of the year .
wilder reckons it 's a great chance to get right in the hunt for the title .
the trick is now to keep showing consistency as we have in the last thirteen games .
we 're right in the hunt for getting out of the division . ''
author: Andy Giddings
Sports Editor, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: home secretary accused of making wrong decision over battle of orgreave inquiry
text: a police and crime commissioner who acted for miners when she was a barrister said the home secretary was wrong not to order an inquiry into policing at the 'battle of orgreave ' .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: ex-blades footballer 's abuse claims prompt others to come forward
text: six people have come forward to police after a former footballer spoke of the abuse he suffered at the hands of his coach .
former sheffield united player andy woodward told how he was abused by coach barry bennell while at crewe alexandra between the ages of 11 and 15 .
bennell was jailed for nine years in 1998 after pleading guilty to sexual offences .
anyone who may have experienced or is experiencing abuse can contact the nspcc 's confidential 24-hour helpline on 0808 800 5000 or childline for children and young people on 0800 1111 .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: listen : hathersage flood floating cars
text: people sprang to help those trapped by floodwater in hathersage last night .
dramatic scenes of cars floating have been reported .
dr chris press went to help as part of his role with the east midlands immediate care scheme .
he 's been speaking to bbc radio sheffield 's paul walker :
author: Paul Walker
Match of the Day commentator

documents.title: pat on back for sheffield museum
text: sheffield 's national emergency services museum was highly commended at the white rose awards last night .
the museum tells the history of the emergency services and its oldest exhibit dates back to 1710 , it 's a manual fire pump .
the white rose awards celebrate businesses involved in tourism in yorkshire .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: decision on big retail project
text: sheffield city councillors will today make their final decision on phase one of the city 's long-awaited new retail quarter .
the first phase - a six-storey office block to be hsbc 's new home - is part of a major city centre development .
historic england has objected to the proposals

without amendments they will do substantial damage to the city centre conservation area - losing most of the listed building , the old bethel sunday school and robbing leah 's yard of all its historic context . ''
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: new wimbledon roof to be made in sheffield
text: an engineering company in sheffield has won the contract to build a second retractable roof for the tennis at wimbledon .
scx made the famous roof to allow all-weather play on centre court .
now the all england lawn tennis club wants another one on number one court .
as well as guaranteeing play in all weather conditions it will increase the seating capacity .
much of the construction work will be carried out at scx 's new tyler street factory in sheffield .
author: Everard Davy
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: flood warnings ease
text: the environment agency has lifted all of the local flood warnings .
they say river levels are falling .
some flood alerts remain in place .
you can find those here .
author: Everard Davy
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: 'chest deep ' water in hathersage say mountain rescuers
text: parts of hathersage were badly affected by flooding yesterday .
this was the scene on school lane
members of edale mountain rescue said parts of the area were `` chest deep '' in water and some vehicles had just their roofs visible .
@ twitterid this was the scene on school lane in hathersage derbyshire yesterday afternoon there were actually 4 cars floating around .

BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: south yorkshire road problem
text: if you happen to be on the road in south yorkshire this evening you need to watch out for a problem near the flouch roundabout .
the a616 is closed west between the a6102 and the roundabout due to flooding .

documents.title: localised flooding in sheffield
text: mat galvin tweeted this earlier of problems in south yorkshire .

documents.title: weather update : latest overnight
text: our meteorologist paul hudson has just given me an update :
he says that despite raining all day , the period between 16:00 and 19:00 saw a rapid increase in the rate of rainfall .
that extra rain saw rivers rising rapidly .
autumn leaves also blocked drains meaning surface water was unable to escape .
he adds that rivers have not been breached and levels appear now to be starting to fall .
paul says he expects further showers , some heavy , overnight and into the morning but is not expecting further prolonged heavy rain which would cause further problems .

text: flood sirens in area inundated last year

text: there has been widespread disruption for people using the trains in and around sheffield this evening .
national rail say there is serious disruption to journeys between manchester piccadilly/stockport and sheffield .
the issues include :
there will be no northern service from the city station for the rest of the evening .
you can find the latest on the train disruption here .
this was the scene in abbeydale road in the city earlier this evening :

text: there are reports of local flooding as drains struggle to cope with the heavy rain .
the streets ahead team in sheffield has highlighted problems on main road in darnall , abbeydale road south near to dore train station , shalesmoor and main road in stocksbridge .
get in touch if the rain 's affecting things where you are .

documents.title: travel : heavy rain causing problems in sheffield
text: take extra care if you 're driving along abbeydale road south this afternoon .
it 's waterlogged near the junction of dore road , and motorists are being asked to slow down .
check if the rain 's causing problems on your route by clicking here .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: police investigating pensioner fraud in barnsley
text: police have released a photo of a man they want to speak with in connection with the attempted fraud of a pensioner in barnsley .
it 's after a man attended the 84-year-old 's home last month and demanded money for bogus building work .
he left empty handed , however officers believe this may have been a targeted attack .
always ask for an identity card and examine it carefully .
if you 're still unsure you can always ask them to return later when someone will be with you or alternatively , ask them to wait outside while you call their employer. ``
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: rioting doncaster inmates to be punished
text: inmates who took part in a disturbance at hmp moorland will be punished and could spend longer behind bars , according to the prison service .
forty prisoners were involved in rioting yesterday , in which two were injured and 15 cells were trashed .
the facility 's expected to return to normal this afternoon .
specially trained staff have successfully resolved an isolated incident involving a small number of prisoners on one wing at hmp moorland .
we are absolutely clear that prisoners who behave in this way will be punished and could spend significantly longer behind bars . ''
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: former prison officer praises bravery of staff at doncaster jail
text: a retired prison officer has told bbc radio sheffield that staff at hmp moorland have `` hearts of lions '' , following a riot at the jail yesterday .
around forty prisoners were involved in the disturbance , in which 15 cells were damaged .
two inmates were injured during the riot , while 30 have been moved to other prisons .
i take my hat off to the courage of the staff who 're going in there to face a thousand prisoners a day , with massively reduced staffing levels .
they 've got to have hearts of lions to do it . ''
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: listen : our new schedule !
text: do n't worry , all your favourite presenters will still be gracing the airwaves - we 've just shaken things up a bit .
listen below to hear what our new weekday , daytime line-up will look like .
author: Rony Robinson
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: weather watchers : wonderful wortley
text: thanks to our weather watcher , grahams shack , for this photo of wortley .
keep them coming !
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: watch : happy world hello day !
text: you may not have known there was such a thing , but it 's world hello day today !
it was first created in 1973 in response to the yom kippur war in the middle east , to show people that communication , and not violence , is the way to bring about peace .
and we thought we 'd celebrate the event here at bbc sheffield :
author: Rony Robinson
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: more awards for former sheffield inner ring road
text: a scheme to transform the city 's former inner ring road into series of sustainable meadows and public art has celebrated its fifth award of the year .
grey to green won the national green champion award , construction , category at a ceremony held at the houses of parliament earlier this month .

the project 's already won two yorkshire in bloom awards , the gold standard and best environmental project in yorkshire 2016 and a brace of sheffield design awards , for best open space and overall outstanding project award 2016 .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: why are tories dropping election candidate ?
text: why are tories dropping election candidate ?

documents.title: pensioner on mobility scooter hurt in doncaster crash
text: a 92-year-old man 's been seriously injured after his mobility scooter crashed with a bus near doncaster town centre .
it happened just after 10:30 on saturday outside st james church .
the single decker was travelling along st sepulchre gate west towards hexthorpe , at the same time the elderly man was driving a mobility scooter on the pavement .
he was immediately taken to hospital .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: breakinglife in jail for sheffield man who killed grandma and aunt
text: a drug user from crosspool who strangled his grandmother and drowned his aunt in a bath , has been jailed for life .

christopher whelan of dransfield road was sentenced to a minimum of 15-years behind bars at nottingham crown court , after admitting manslaughter on the grounds of diminished responsibility at an earlier hearing .
the 21-year-old went to the shirebrook home of his 51-year-old aunt , julie hill , in february and killed her along with his 75-year-old grandmother , rose hill , who was visiting the house .
whelan later claimed to have heard satan directing him during the attacks .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: weather : lots of heavy rain
text: if you 're heading out this afternoon , then grab your wellies and a brolly !
the met office has issued a yellow weather warning due to lots of rain expected between now and 06:00 tomorrow .
more heavy rain tonight , and turning foggy too .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: rubbish dumping still a problem despite police crackdown
text: these are the scenes in one eastwood street , just seven days after a police blitz on crime and antisocial behaviour in the area .
fly-tipping returns to eastwood a week after council and police declare success of blitz on anti-social behaviour @ twitterid
hi andy - the bulky waste on the street is out for a paid collection by council .
wardens there this am .
thanks emma nice one !
do you have the address of the rear yard so that council can double check it is one being dealt with ?
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: e-fit released in sheffield armed robbery
text: police investigating a robbery in the high green area of the city , have released an e-fit of the man they are trying to trace .
at around 22:45 on tuesday november 1st , a man entered a supermarket and threatened workers with what is believed to be a knife .
he then ran towards the direction of pack horse lane after stealing some cash .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: sport : rotherham boss says side struggling in league
text: rotherham boss kenny jackett has admitted that his side are struggling to hold their own in the championship .
the millers sit bottom of the table nine points from safety and have lost eight of their last nine games :
author: Jonathan Buchan
BBC Radio Sheffield Sport

documents.title: sheffield man to be sentenced for killing his grandma and aunt
text: a drug user from crosspool who strangled his grandmother and drowned his aunt in a bath , will be sentenced for the killings at court today .

21-year-old christopher whelan armed himself with an axe and a penknife during the attacks on julie hill and 75-year-old rose hill , after allegedly struggling against an `` irresistible impulse '' to kill others .
whelan - from dransfield road in crosspool - later claimed to have heard satan directing him as he killed the victims at his aunt 's home in shirebrook in february .
he admitted the manslaughter of both victims on the grounds of diminished responsibility .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: jail riot : main concern to 'make prison safe '
text: a spokesman for the prison officers association at hmp moorland says the jail is trying to `` get back to some normality '' following yesterday 's riot .
paul lennon says there has been some fire damage and problems with the lights after inmates at the prison near doncaster smashed 36 cells .
60 prisoners have been moved to other jails .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: northern powerhouse economy 'needs transport investment '
text: politicians in northern england say they want chancellor philip hammond to prioritise transport links in the region to make it more attractive to investors .
the labour politicians , representing leeds , manchester , newcastle , sheffield and liverpool , say northern motorways are reaching `` saturation point '' .
and they say train capacity in what has been dubbed the northern powerhouse economic region is `` at the limit '' .
the treasury says an extra £ 1.3bn will be spent uk-wide to tackle congestion .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: prison riot latest : 'we 're in darkness in there . it 's not good '
text: the branch chairman of hmp moorland prison officers association has spoken following trouble at the jail near doncaster .
paul lennon said rioting broke out at around 17:45 yesterday during `` lock-up time '' .
over 30 cells were smashed during the disturbance - 60 prisoners have now been moved to different jails .
we 've lost house block 2 a-wing .
there is some fire damage - to what extent we do n't know yet because it 's cordoned off.the lights and everything are out so we 're in darkness in there at the moment and it 's not good .
our main concern is to make the prison safe and try to get back to some normality . ''
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: 'no additional cost ' to police sheffield tree felling cutting
text: south yorkshire police say the cost of providing 12 officers to police last week 's controversial tree cutting near endcliffe park , was done at `` no additional cost '' .
three protesters were arrested after council contractors amey began cutting down trees in rustlings road in the early hours of the morning .
the deployment to rustlings road on thursday formed part of our policing activity for the day so no additional officers were required and there was no additional cost to south yorkshire police . ''
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: travel : m1 southbound re-opened but traffic still heavy
text: the good news is that all lanes have been re-opened on the m1 southbound , after they were closed due to a broken down lorry .
the bad news is that traffic 's still backing up between j36 , a61 ( birdwell ) and j34 , a631 ( meadowhall ) .
click here for your latest travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watch : kellingley closure documentary
text: nearly a year on , a special programme takes a look back at the closure of kellingley colliery :
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: sport : sheffield golfer matthew fitzpatrick celebrates dubai win
text: sheffield 's matthew fitzpatrick has won the european tour 's season-ending event , the dp world tour championship in dubai .
the 22-year-old 's beaten nick faldo 's record as the youngest englishman to win three times on tour .
author: Everard Davy
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: watch : tree protesters want details of council contract revealed
text: campaigners angry over sheffield council 's handling of tree felling near endcliffe park last week are calling for more transparency over its dealings with contractors amey .
there was outrage when amey and the police turned up to cut down trees in rustlings road in the early hours of the morning .
sheffield city council claim saving them would have cost £ 10,000 per tree .
tree campaigners in sheffield call for 'openness & transparency ' in demand for publication of details in councils contract with @ twitterid
then amey rock up next day and try to fell rustlings road tree whilst folks are at work .
our community said no .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: sixty prisoners moved after riot at doncaster jail
text: the prison officers association say that 60 inmates have been moved from hmp moorland to other jails after a riot last night .
prisoners smashed up their cells , putting 36 on one wing out of action because of fire and water damage .
specially trained staff have successfully resolved an isolated incident involving a small number of prisoners on one wing at hmp moorland .
we are absolutely clear that prisoners who behave in this way will be punished and could spend significantly longer behind bars . ''
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: the fast life of dalian atkinson
text: fast cars and girls were of equal importance to football in the early career of dalian atkinson .

documents.title: hmp moorland disturbance latest
text: i 'm at hmp moorland near doncaster , which was the scene of disorder last night .
the prison service says reinforcements were sent to deal with an `` isolated incident '' .
1 prisoner injured after 40 inmates on one wing involved in a disturbance last night at hmp moorland .
@ twitterid says they will be punished
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: calls for transparency over sheffield council 's dealings with contractor
text: campaigners against the felling of roadside trees near endcliffe park , say it 's a scandal that key details of the authority 's contract with the construction company amey are being kept confidential .
there was outrage last week when amey and the police turned up to cut down trees in rustlings road in the early hours of the morning .
the council say the bill for engineering work to keep those trees would have been £ 10,000 per tree .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: doncaster prison hit by inmates 'trouble '
text: specially-trained staff had to be sent to hmp moorland near doncaster to control an `` isolated incident '' .
the trouble between a `` small number '' of inmates on one wing of the facility was quelled overnight , the prison service said .
one prisoner was injured but did not require hospital treatment .
no staff were hurt .
hm inspectorate of prisons found `` high '' levels of violence in its latest inspection of the jail in february .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : broken-down car causing delays on a57
text: one lane 's blocked and traffic 's backing up on the a57 westbound in sheffield between the a630 junction and the a6102 prince of wales road junction .
it 's because of .
a broken-down car .
there 's congestion right back to to coisley hill roundabout .
do n't forget to check your latest travel here .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : cold with heavy rain
text: rain spreading north this morning , becoming heavy , and temporarily falling as snow over high ground .
feeling cold everywhere as it becomes windy with coastal gales developing .
here 's my full forecast
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning : welcome to today 's coverage
text: how was your weekend ?
i took my daughters indoor trampolining , which was fun and exhausting in equal measure !
i 'll be bringing you all the very latest news , sport , travel and weather from across south yorkshire until 18:00 .
do n't forget to get in touch !
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield
